name: incident-filters-for-text-view-list;issue-lt-276-text-view-regression-browser-chrome-context-chrome-feature-lt25-text-view-lt-273-text-view-of-incidents-capability-lt-25-text-view

tags.name: LT 25 Text View/LT-273 Text View of Incidents

title: Incident filters for text view list

testSteps.description: Given I am at the LiveTraffic Website
Then I click on the menu button
Then I click "List View" button from the menu list

And I should see filters for "All Sydney"
| Region |
| Sydney Inner |
| Sydney North |
| Sydney South |
| Sydney West |

And I should see all incident type icons and incident count
| Incident_Types |
| Crash |
| Breakdown |
| General Hazards |
| Traffic signals |
| Roadworks |
| Low impact roadworks |
| Changed Traffic Conditions |
| Public Events |
| Fire |
| Flood |
| SnowIce |
| Adverse Weather |
Then I should see "All incident types" filter is turned off by default

Then I should see incidents filter status as below
| Incident_Type | Status |
| Crash | ON |
| Breakdown | ON |
| General Hazards | ON |
| Traffic signals | ON |
| Roadworks | ON |
| Low impact roadworks | OFF |
| Changed Traffic Conditions | ON |
| Public events | ON |
| Fire | ON |
| Flood | ON |
| Snow/Ice | ON |
| Adverse Weather | ON |
Then I should see Incident display with text as "Started 10 March, 2020 1:38pm, Last checked 10 March, 2020 1:39pm"
When I turn "on" All incident type filter

Then I should see incidents filter status as below
| Incident_Type | Status |
| Crash | ON |
| Breakdown | ON |
| General Hazards | ON |
| Traffic signals | ON |
| Roadworks | ON |
| Low impact roadworks | ON |
| Changed Traffic Conditions | ON |
| Public events | ON |
| Fire | ON |
| Flood | ON |
| Snow/Ice | ON |
| Adverse Weather | ON |
Then I should see Incident display with text as "Started 10 March, 2020 1:38pm, Last checked 10 March, 2020 1:39pm"
When I turn "off" All incident type filter

Then I should see incidents filter status as below
| Incident_Type | Status |
| Crash | OFF |
| Breakdown | OFF |
| General Hazards | OFF |
| Traffic signals | OFF |
| Roadworks | OFF |
| Low impact roadworks | OFF |
| Changed Traffic Conditions | OFF |
| Public events | OFF |
| Fire | OFF |
| Flood | OFF |
| Snow/Ice | OFF |
| Adverse Weather | OFF |
Then I should not see Incident display with text as "Started 10 March, 2020 1:38pm, Last checked 10 March, 2020 1:39pm"
And I should see No data message heading as "No incidents match your selection"
And I should see No data message as "Try expanding your selected regions or incident types to see current or future incidents."
